verses.verse: ((1 He describeth the crooked nature.4 The cruelty,5 And punishment of the wicked, when they look not for it,6 And desireth the deliverance of the godly, that they may rejoice together.) The fool hath said in his heart, There is (Whereas no regard is had of honesty or dishonesty, of virtue nor of vice, there the Prophet pronounceth that the people have no God.) no God, they have corrupted and done abominable wickedness, there is none that doeth good.

God looked down from heaven upon the children of men, to see if there were any that would understand and (Whereby he condemneth all knowledge and understanding, that tendeth not to seek God.) seek God.
(Cross references: : Rom. 3:10) Everyone is gone back: they are altogether corrupt: there is none that doeth good, no not one.

Do not the (David pronounceth God’s vengeance against cruel governors, who having charge to defend and preserve God’s people, do most cruelly devour them.) workers of iniquity know that they eat up my people as they eat bread? they call not upon God.

There they were afraid for fear, where no (When they thought there was none occasion to fear, the sudden vengeance of God lighted upon them.) fear was: for God hath scattered the (Be the enemy’s power never so great, nor the danger so fearful, yet God delivereth his in due time.) bones of him that besieged thee: thou hast put them to confusion, because God hath cast them off.
Oh give salvation unto Israel out of Zion: when God turneth the captivity of his people, then Jacob shall rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.
